stories.title: Netflix’s Big Power Clash and Rivalries Behind the Crash

stories.text:
Dataplane is the data platform that makes it far easier for your data team to build and scale a data mesh with automated data pipelines and workflows.

It is early days for Dataplane with the first beta release. Still much to do! I would love to hear your thoughts and for you to get involved.

Go check out the demo at https://dataplane.app or use the quick start guide to install a cluster locally using either Docker Compose or Minikube.

Here are the highlights:

* Written in Golang and compiled to machine code for extreme performance with a low memory and CPU footprint. Front end built in React with secure JWT tokens, real-time Websockets and GraphQL. * No code drag and drop data pipeline builder. * Built in online Python code editor – no more configuring developer spec laptops for your data team to get going or to train new data team members. * Granular permissions for teams to collaborate with segregated access. * Secrets management with logging redaction allows team members to use secure resources without revealing passwords or API keys. * Scheduler with multiple time zone support and per second scheduling. * Setup isolated environments to develop, test & deploy across data mesh domains. * Distributed computing with worker groups. You can configure different types of workers for different parts of a data pipeline, for example, NLP or AI deep learning workers versus vanilla Python with pandas data frame workers. * Monitor worker nodes in real-time resource usage and logging. * A Dataplane cluster can horizontally scale to many instances connected over a NATS message bus, providing self-healing, resilience and scale – this includes leader election and distribution locking for data pipeline run time safety. * Cloud native – deploy and scale on Kubernetes in your favourite cloud provider.
